DOC.brief_summary: The aim of the study is to compare polyethylene wear in an uncemented total hip prosthesis with 3rd. generation highly cross-linked polyethylene with a 32 mm ceramic femoral head compared to a 36 mm ceramic head. Using X-ray, RSA and DEXA. The polyethylene to be used is E-Poly (Biomet). The H0 hypothesis is that there is no difference with regard to polyethylene wear and bone loss between the two groups.
DOC.brief_title: Wear Measurements of E-Poly in an Uncemented THA With Either 32 or 36 mm Caput of Ceramics.
DOC.detailed_description: Uncemented THA, 32 mm or 36 mm caput of ceramics, E-Poly inserts. Measure wear with RSA, X-Ray and bone mineral density with DEXA.
DOC.criteria: 5065 years old Primary or secondary osteoarthritis Significant anatomical divergence are excluded Rheumatoid arthritis Fracture sequelae Dysplasia Immune suppression or grave systemic illness
